title: Alternatives to Minion
content: Looking for a modern elegant replacement to Minion suitable for setting magazines. The x height needs to be very similar. Thanks in advance.
author: alex parke

comments.content:
1. What kind of magazine?  
2. How is it printed?  
3. What is it printed on?  
4. Who are the readers?

There's dozens of choices. Answering a few simple questions regarding context makes the task far easier and removes aesthetic guesswork. Garamond and Sabon are pretty good fallbacks. [Nick Shinn](http://web.archive.org/web/20101002050245/http:/typophile.com/user/2021) would be a good person to ask.

1. Its a Government Magazine with a different theme each publication.  
2. It is printed on a Heidelberg web press with Aqueous coating.  
3. 60# Utopia dull No2 grade.  
4. Geared towards a diverse resident base covering major departments such as Environmental, Transportation, Public Health etc. Each has a Page and/or a spread dedicated to them but they all have to fit within a theme. This issue is all about how their tax dollars are spent. It usually has a "Newsweek" feel for content and a "Wired" style for layout and graphics with a size similar to the "T magazine"

I don't dislike Minion I just want a modern version. Currently Minion is paired with Din and Titling. I have explored the use of FF Yoga as a good all round super family, Brioni because of its suitability for magazines and Premiera for its X height. Would these substitute well?

Thanks

Insiders will guess what [my hints are always about](http://web.archive.org/web/20101002050245/http:/www.signographie.de/cms/front_content.php?idart=69) ;-)
